It belongs to the family Zeocritonaceae and is characterized by its flat, broad leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its root system is fibrous and adapted to nutrient-poor soils, allowing it to thrive in specific ecological niches. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat requirements, Zeocriton complanatum is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
